message: Seems like we could all benefit from a combination of django patches where needed and some extra libraries

Another idea is possible to beef up the admin? Maybe build in more admin components to 1.4? I don't know about others but I know that we are always customizing admin or getting complaints that our admin sucks in house.
One thing I've been really  tempted to contribute for 1.4 is a generic AJAX autocomplete to replace the raw_id fields
We've been threatening to have sprints for awhile - it's time to dust that idea off
We've had several offers for space (LOC is an option any day of the week except for Sunday and that's good for at least 50 people)
django-tablib is nifty, too - I just tossed in a bunch of "download to excel" links to avoid needing to do so much ad-hoc reporting
and we could blow some dust off of django-qourisman
yes that would.
OMG yes! there are a couple out there, but it needs to be built in
whole* not hole :-)
Last week's exchange starting with https://twitter.com/greglinch/status/38251944787050497 also made me wonder if there was any interest in something journalism or open-data related

RE: journo/open-data - There is a computer assisted reporting conference next week. There is discussion among that group to try to work something. I want to throw out the possibility that maybe we can keep on eye on that & see if there wasn't anything to build on or polish?
Although I'd be inclined to bring the discussion wider after we have enough people here committed to showing up

I have been wanting a tool in built in python that imports a simple csv & that auto outputs various data formats or saves to db. It seems like that happens over and over again. I can't remember who now, but one exists in Ruby.
If I'm understanding that right, anyway, and if so I do believe we'd have a supportive upstream
Score... task complete. Next task.
That'd be a great idea - I know @coordt, @richleland, @joshourisman and I have all spent time on it
Sounds like a good idea to me - are you going? If nothing else, it seems like we should extend the offer
yes
jezdez & russell liked the idea but were concerned about stability rushing it into 1.3
So…
Topics?
Several Django committers have offered to be on IRC, or potentially even visit, if we want to try to help with 1.4
I actually have a patch which I'm hoping to get into 10.4 (https://github.com/acdha/django/tree/admin-template-response) which will change all of the admin views to return TemplateResponses
Yes
I've been meaning to look in more detail at what @coordt's been doing in the Calloway work as he's definitely pushing down that path
Hmmm - sounds like that's getting close to tablib
That'd make a LOT of customization easier
I am very excited about working on something like this.... but I think it would be nice to build an additional library or straight into django - things that people constantly make requests for.
as far as admin customization
https://bitbucket.org/izi/django-admin-tools/ tools is I think most of it
I could consider something a must have, because it is important to me, but we might be missing a bigger need.
Yes
I wonder if we could reach out to the django community as a hole, have people submit what features they would like & have people vote.
yes... people... that is a must have. :-)
Figure we can invite people to be on IRC, etc. but I'd like everyone to be working on roughly similar things just to make sure the experience goes well
Also I figure that if we're all a little selfish and working on something which makes our lives easier, we're more likely to actually do it ;)
Sprinting? I dunno, I'm sort of out of shape. How about jogging?
Maybe @ericflo can add a /rimshot command?
convore? om nom nom nom!
